docs.snippet: Baltimore, which had already lost Dennis Pitta to a season-ending hip injury earlier in training camp, suffered another injury with Ed Dickson’s slight hamstring tear....
docs.lead_paragraph: Baltimore, which had already lost Dennis Pitta to a season-ending hip injury earlier in training camp, suffered another injury with Ed Dickson’s slight hamstring tear.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Baltimore Ravens tight end Ed Dickson will miss at least a week of practice with torn hamstring; other NFL developments noted.

headline.main: Ravens, With Pitta Out, Lose Another Tight End

docs.snippet: Allegations that Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel signed autographs for money has heightened public sentiment that is increasingly hostile over the N.C.A.A.’s amateurism rule....
docs.lead_paragraph: Allegations that Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel signed autographs for money has heightened public sentiment that is increasingly hostile over the N.C.A.A.’s amateurism rule.
docs.abstract: Greg Bishop On College Football column notes that NCAA has declined to confirm or comment on ESPN's report that the association is investigating whether Texas A&M quarterback signed autographs at the Bowl Championship Series national title game for a fee, rule long ago deemed draconian by advocates of NCAA change.

headline.main: A Heisman Winner, and a Rule Book, Under Fire
headline.print_headline: A Heisman Winner, and a Rule Book, Under Fire

docs.snippet: After serving almost six years behind bars for a crime he didn’t commit, Brian Banks is trying to make it in the N.F.L. with the Atlanta Falcons....
docs.lead_paragraph: After serving almost six years behind bars for a crime he didn’t commit, Brian Banks is trying to make it in the N.F.L. with the Atlanta Falcons.
docs.abstract: Atlanta Falcons rookie linebacker Brian Banks, who served almost six years behind bars for a rape he did not commit, is trying to make it in the NFL at age 28; his conviction was overturned in 2012 when his accuser admitted she had made up her story.

headline.main: At 28, Rookie Refuses to Focus on Time Lost
headline.print_headline: At 28, Rookie Refuses To Focus on Time Lost

docs.snippet: Would a new superdivision for college football and men’s basketball be a step toward ending the hypocrisy?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Would a new superdivision for college football and men’s basketball be a step toward ending the hypocrisy?
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column notes that some of most powerful figures in college sports have begun to put forward idea he has long endorsed--shifting college teams to new, professional leagues; warns that proposal, which would only include the big five conferences for football and basketball, has several shortcomings, including lack of compensation for players.

headline.main: The Plot to Rule College Sports
headline.print_headline: The Plot to Rule College Sports
